Lack of shipping space for merchandise from 2. 1 have received complaints from two merchants who were given quotas for leather goods for ±943 from India, that they have been unable to ship the goods from Bombay up to the present owing to lack of shipping space. 3. At the Merchant’s Meeting today it was confirmed by members present tnat quota goods are lying unshipped in india, due to the inability of merchants to find shipping space. 4. I should be grateful if the Government of India could be moved to give this subject their consider ation, and if necessary draw up a shipping programme for Gulf Ports. ltd. T. Hickinbothan Political Agent, BahrainCopy of menorandura No. PA/392, dated the 21st 1944, from the Director of Customs and Port Officer to the Political Agent, Bahrain. May , Bahrain, 7ith reference to your request for information in reapect of cargo awaiting shipments in India, the undernoted are the iigures ot tonnages as supplied me by the importers:- COMMODITY : CALCUTTA : BOMBAY : KARACHI. Copy forwarded to the Secretary to thei/Hon^le the Political Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushire, with reference to mji Express Letter No. 1434 -36/29, dated the 15th May 1944. • for Political Agent, Bahrain.Extract from the Minutes of the meeting held on 19-6-44 1* Tea and Sup;ar • — i. O \ CliO UCJ UC 31 X 1 The Director of Customs represented that difficulty (g)V was being experienced in obtaining sugar and tea* It was point ed out by members of the Committed that although some rail space / i was available to bring tea from Calcutta bo Bombay it would hot be possible to move the total amount of Bahrain tea at present lying in Calcutta by rail to Bombay. The Political Agent stated that he would make representations to the proper authority with a view to obtaining an increase in shipping space both from Cal cutta and from Bombay.(ScfSgd) a M. tfakflUJfcCfcN INDIA OFFICE A'fl a -6Src C ^’ - 72 ^+^^. -j. !*!< Economic and Overseas Dgpapijnent# EXPRESS LETTER (FAST AIR MATT.) (N.B, - Tills is an original message, sent by air mail to save telegraphic expense, but intended to be treated on receipt with the same expedition as if it had been telegraphed* It has been drafted as if it were so despatched.) Reference Paragraphs 81 and 82 of Bahrein Intelligence Summary No. 9 dated 15th May, in regard to difficulty of obtaining shipping space for goods from India to Bahrein and Trucial Coast. Ministry of Transport are taking the matter up v/ith their Representative in Delhi. They suggest that if a similar situation should arise in future, you should make direct contract with their representa tive in Delhi through the usual channels. From Secretary of State for India. Political Resident, Persian Culf. Repeat to Political Agent Bahrein and Government of India. location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'File 36/56 Lack of Shipping Space for Goods from India'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the front to the rear of the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 14; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-12; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled.

mods.abstract: This file contains correspondence regarding delays in goods being shipped to Bahrain from India. The Correspondence is primarily between the Political Agency in Bahrain, the Government of India and the Government of Bahrain Customs Department.
